DataElement.preferredName: Serum Total Bilirubin Measurement Laboratory Procedure Performed Finding Status Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the status of the laboratory results for total serum bilirubin.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Serum Total Bilirubin Measurement Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins._Bilirubin is a breakdown product of hemoglobin. Total and direct bilirubin are usually measured to screen for or to monitor liver or gall bladder dysfunction. (from MedlinePlus Medical Encyclopedia)_Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Serum Total Bilirubin Measurement Laboratory Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:Bilirubin is a breakdown product of hemoglobin. Total and direct bilirubin are usually measured to screen for or to monitor liver or gall bladder dysfunction. (from MedlinePlus Medical Encyclopedia):A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.

The measurement of the total amount of bilirubin present in a particular substrate. The substrate most often tested is blood, but other fluids extracted from the body may be used periodically depending on the purpose of the test.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.
